titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1691) to protect religious liberty.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-229, by Mrs. Myrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1691 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. The amendment recommended by the Committee on the Judiciary now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order. The amendment printed in the Congressional Record, if offered by Mr. Conyers or his designee, shall be considered as read and shall be separately debatable for one hour, equally divided and controlled.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 85.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 245.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/13/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 1691 (religious liberty protection).
